cursor.about: Causes the list of IDs to be broken into pages of no more than 5000 IDs at a time. The number of IDs returned is not guaranteed to be 5000 as suspended users are filtered out. If no cursor is provided, a value of -1 will be assumed, which is the first “page.”The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth. See [node:10362, title=”Using cursors to navigate collections”] for more information.
